text: The interior of the submarine was dark. He sat down, surrounded by machinery, and looked out of the archbishop's window. I saw the scenery of the port. “You may see a boat, the Kongo,” an official said. While contemplating a warship in the squared glass, he was reminded, without knowing why, of the peregrine. The pistachio on a bistec of at thirty centimeters on the plate. And of its delicate aroma. FIN Life of an Idiot, 1927
title: Base naval
author: Ryunosuke Akutagawa
